CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. 2 reads: "Polio Clinic Successful - The L'Egants' Polio Clinic, held at Hill City recently, was very successful. Dr. Irsael Feldman was the physician in charge.  Nurses, representing the Central Health District, were Miss Lillie M. Lesense, Mrs. M. Smith and Miss Mary James from the County Health Department.  Staff members from Hill City and the Friendly Service Bureau assisted...in the right photo is part of the large crowd which cam for polio shots.-Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Large group of men, women, and children, including woman wearing beaded necklace, holding cotton while preparing young child for Polio vaccine, gathered in Hill City for L'Egants' Club Polio Clinic, Hill District
